alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta; Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 5:39AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...A SIGNIFICANT PATTERN CHANGE FOR SOUTHWEST ALASKA THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK... A Fall-like period will take shape as a series of fronts move through Southwest Alaska this weekend. The first front will move to the Kuskokwim Delta coast this evening spreading a rain/snow mix to all regions. Another front quickly follows on Sunday morning, bringing another round of mixed precipitation with a transition to snow possible over the Kuskokwim Delta and Lower Kuskokwim Valley by Sunday night. Total snow accumulations will generally be less than 1 inch for the low- lying areas with 2 inches possible along the mountains. Winds are also expected to increase this evening and overnight to 15 and 30 mph by Sunday morning. An unseasonably cold airmass accompanying the aforementioned front will bring below normal temperatures for this time of the year as well. Light precipitation with cooler than normal temperatures will persist through Tuesday.

area.areaDesc: Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta; Lower Kuskokwim Valley
